automat
Class Habitat

java.lang.Object
  automat.Habitat
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReferenceSystem2D
public class Habitat
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReferenceSystem2D

Represents a set of cells to be used by a cellular automat.

Author:
Wolfgang Bongartz

Constructor Detail

Habitat

public Habitat(int width,
               int height,
               boolean moore)
Parameters:
width - Number of cells in x-direction
height - Number of cells in y-direction
moore - False: Neumann-environment. True: Moore-environment.
Method Detail

populateRandomly

public void populateRandomly(java.util.ArrayList<Inhabitant> _inhabitantTemplates,
                             int percentage)
Fills the habitat randomly with inhabitants.

Parameters:
_inhabitantTemplates - List of templates for the new inhabitants. Chosen randomly.
percentage - Defines how much space is to be filled (0..100).

populateCompletely

public void populateCompletely(java.util.ArrayList<Inhabitant> templates)
Fill the habitat completely with inhabitants. Re-uses source of pseudo-random-numbers.

Parameters:
templates - List of templates for the new inhabitants. Chosen randomly.

visit

public void visit(Coordinate position,
                  Visitor v)
Perform whatever is defined for the visitor. E.g.: Call v.perform() for the cell with the givven position.

Parameters:
position - Position of the cell thats visited.
v - Visitor (an instance of a class that implements the Visitor-interface)
See Also:
Visitor

visitAll

public void visitAll(Visitor v)
Perform whatever is defined for the visitor on every cell. E.g.: Call v.perform() for all cells.

Parameters:
v - Visitor (an instance of a class that implements the Visitor-interface)
See Also:
Visitor
